results.title: Arctic outpost
results.creator_credit: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Life at the small settlement of Pangnirtung on eastern Baffin Island, where there is as a Royal Canadian Mounted Police post, a Hudson’s Bay Company store, a mission hospital and a government school. The film presents on-the-spot accounts of the work of all of these. This is a shorter version of the film “Pangnirtung”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Arctic nomads
results.brief_description: Life at the tiny outpost of Masi, on the edge of the vast Finnmark plateau over which the nomadic Lapps have wandered for centuries. Lapp children are shown at their lessons in a school built be the Norwegian State. Out on the plateau a family is shown living a primitive tent life, and preparing their sledges and reindeer to migrate to the coast in the spring. No other credits available.

results.title: Arctic jungle
results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
The life of the Eskimo is a constant struggle for existence against the harshness of the Arctic environment. The film shows spear fishing, making lamp fuel, manufacturing clothing and kayaks, and hunting powerful quarry like the polar bear and white whale.

results.title: Arctic dog team
results.brief_description: A study of the training of husky dogs for their work in the Arctic and of the valuable part they play in the life of the Eskimos. Commentary by Doug Wilkinson. No other credits available.

results.title: Arctic 4
results.creator_credit: Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A long film report of a new and daring step toward understanding what lies under the Arctic ice. This is the story of an Arctic diving expedition led by Dr. Joseph MacInnes and a team of scientists, during two months of continuous springtime daylight. The dives are a test of both men and equipment as well as an exploration of the high northern marine environment. What they discovered is interestingly documented in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Architecture west
results.brief_description: Shows examples of architecture in the Western American states beginning with the square log block house that served as General Sheridan’s headquarters at Yam Hill, Oregon. The Monterey style house built for the American consul to Mexican California, a Victorian mansion, the First Church of Christ Scientist at Berkeley, the steel-aluminium -glass Equitable Building in Portland, Oregon, the Prudential building in Los Angeles, and modern homes designed by John Yoen, depicting important influences and style.

results.title: Architecture of Japan
results.brief_description: Shows how the traditional architectural design elements based on wooden construction are adopted to the steel and concrete in contemporary building in Japan. Examples of historical, traditional and modern architecture which are distinctively Japanese are surveyed.
results.description: Shows how the traditional architectural design elements based on wooden construction are adopted to the steel and concrete in contemporary building in Japan. Examples of historical, traditional and modern architecture which are distinctively Japanese are surveyed.

results.title: Architecture: a performing art
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description: An overview of the career and lifestyle of the Australian architect, John Andrews whose better known accomplishments include the CTT Tower in Toronto - the tallest free-standing structure in the world, the International Shipping Terminal at Miami, the Cameron Offices in Canberra and the American Express Tower in Sydney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia and Michael Robertson Film Productions

results.title: Architecture
results.creator_credit: Career Productions, Citizen's Assurance and Mutual Life and Citizens' Assurance Co.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The architect is trained to understand the needs of people and how labour, machines and materials can create buildings which meet these needs. Although he may arrange for the help of special experts such as structural or lighting engineers he too must have a grasp of these technical matters.

results.title: Architects of England
results.brief_description: A study of the work of English architects from the eleventh century until the present day, with reference to the kind of material and designs used and adapted for English needs, and the work of Inigo Jones and Christopher Wren.
results.description: A study of the work of English architects from the eleventh century until the present day, with reference to the kind of material and designs used and adapted for English needs, and the work of Inigo Jones and Christopher Wren.
